It's also a very quiet place.

I’ve tent-camped at Kal Haven twice, and both times were great experiences. It’s a large, well-kept property with a nice shower house/restrooms and a very convenient on-site store (with free coffee). It’s off the beaten path a bit, but still close to South Haven, and not nearly as crowded or noisy as nearby state park campgrounds. I’d definitely camp here again.

So very disappointed.   Reserved for 3 nights for week before Memorial Day.  Arrived Monday and there were only 2 other sites that had occupants out of 20.  Very unusual for camping before a holiday.  It was not well maintained but location ideal for walking to town and beach.  Woke up this morning to no power and now only people there.  Found out bill hadn't been paid and electricity had been shut off by power company.
We asked for money back.  Now our vacation was cut short.
Very unprofessional!
Find somewhere else!
Great quite location! It's been so hard to be able to get a spot and very hard to get a water view site. But great walking trails and the sites are pretty good sizes as well.

We had a very fun time celebrating 90th birthday at the shelter next to the dam.  Catered food from local grocery store was very delicious, especially the chicken. Thanks for a great day to celebrate family!

Very busy campground this weekend. For a city-owned campground my opinion is it should be upgraded considerably. Should have outhouses around the whole campground instead of one toilet and bath House. On construction sites they have to have one outhouse for every eight people for osha rules. But here they can have hundreds of people and just bath house with three toilets. They were very dirty and the sign said they were cleaned at noon each day. Out of paper towels. Floor was very muddy .The grounds were very wet and a RV got stuck in his campsite and had to be pulled out by a tow truck. Instead of fixing the site they rented it the next state of somebody else. The trails going through the woods down to the fishing pier we're untouched and you'd think that somebody could trim them out so you could walk through. I know there's nothing they can do about it but the train's going by constantly make it Very noisy. Come on city of Duluth! Step up and make some improvements!

east-grand-forks-mn-red-river-state-recr.editorialSummary: This riverside green space with numerous R.V. hookups offers areas for biking, fishing & boating.

reviewSummary.text:
Such a nice spot to camp! The hosts were helpful and friendly. They were waiting on some final documents from the city to open the shower but they let us in with a disclaimer to not drink any of the water because they didn’t have the final papers for potability. We stayed on an electric only site. There was so much to do in walking distance.

Cost: $30-$45/night
Privacy: limited/nonexistent
Ease of access: very easy
Views/Scenery: this campground is in a large town, near a road, but the campground itself has a large green space and a flood barrier berm so there is a bit of nature to be seen. It also sits next to a large river. There are paved walkways that follow the river, and allow bikes to be ridden.
Cell reception: very good- 4-5 bars on Cricket wireless
Crowded: we were here the first week it was opened after winter, so there were very few others around. The campground hosts said it gets pretty busy and they get full many weekends.
Noise: this should be a definite consideration if you plan to stay here. It is (like I said) in a large town and the campground is adjacent to a busy road, so you will have daytime road noise. The fire station is just on the other side of the flood berm so every time they go out on a call, you’re going to have sirens. It happened frequently the 3 days we stayed here. Also, there is a city warning alarm that they run a test on during the day (it lasted about 60 seconds on a Wednesday around lunch). It’s very loud and you shouldn’t expect to be able to sleep through their test, if you’re a day sleeper.
Wildlife: minimal- squirrels and birds
Distance from nearest town: walking distance to shops (

The new managers are absolutely amazing. So glad they have new ones for many reasons.  They are kind people and will go out of their way to accommodate their campers. They're more than happy to deliver your wood to your site, the bathrooms/showers are cleaner than they ever have been in all the years we've camped here. The sites are always well maintained, the grass, fire pits, tree branches, etc. I can't say enough nice things about this campground and the managers. Thank you for being lovely people!!!! 😊

This was our second stay at West 40 and we were there for 10 days.  We're not in their target demographic and I was a little concerned about possible late night noise from the off-roaders.  I was pleased that all the nights were quiet.  It was a great change of scenery from our travels in Iowa and Missouri.

Paul and Chuck are great owner/managers and Casey gave just the right amount of attention as campground host.  We have already reserved for the same time next year.  We even invited friends to join us this year and they loved it too.

photos.attribution: West Forty RV Park and Campground
West Forty RV Park and Campground
West Forty RV Park and Campground
West Forty RV Park and Campground

reviewSummary.text:
Love this place.  We camped out in a tent and had a great time. Sites are well maintained.  The bathrooms are very clean and the showers are hot and good pressure.
The weather was perfect.
Grand Marais is literally walking distance and very convenient.

Beautiful campground, well-kept, super clean and quiet. We stayed here in 2021 and finally made it back cuz' we loved it.

We rode the Root River trail again, which is a pretty short 1/4 mile trip along the road to get from the campground to the trailhead in Whalan, but in Whalan there is the Pie Shop, so there's a bonus for you pie freaks out there!

Well the owner of the park is a super nice guy and got me in here kinda last minute with a job that came about in the area. The park has alot of spot some are kind of tight but never the less there full hook up and accommodating. The sakata trail which from what I can tell from Google is 70ish miles runs right on the edge of the park and is a nice additive. There really are only two thing that's would've bumped this park right up is if there was WI-FI considering it is advertised as a campground for workers. Second I wish the bathrooms were a little cleaner.

Eight total spaces here, and most if not all are usually taken up by seasonal RVr's here for the summer. We happened to get lucky and were able to get the single opening, albeit mid-week, after calling ahead. We're in a 38' class A with toad. Unhooked at the office. The nice gentleman who owns/operates this establishment parked us. Easy going guy. W/E/S, 50a. Four bars VZ 4G. A handful of OATV channels.

Just far enough off the beaten path that it was quiet, and dark. I'd stay here again.

Easy access to the Heartland trail for walking or biking. Very fun mini-golf course, and ice cream afterwards.

Nice spot to camp  for riding the Root River bike trail.

Has sewer , water, and a restroom  as well as wifi.  Park is clean and kept up  to general standards

For 30 a night I would hope they could keep the soap and toilet paper stocked.

A nice facility, we are likely to return

preston-mn-old-barn-resort.editorialSummary: Sprawling seasonal destination with a restaurant/bar & an 18-hole golf course, plus an indoor pool.

reviewSummary.text: Truly our favorite place to camp. It’s right off of the bike trail so easy access to trails. You can float in the root river around the campsite. It’s about an hour and a half float which is so nice. The site is always clean. The barn has the best cheese curds. The food has never really disappointed us flavor wise! They have a covered pool area that our kids live in when it’s hot. Bathrooms are always kept up which is nice. Because of the proximity to the root river there are hardly ever mosquitoes like in other parts of the state.

This campground is very well kept.  The spaces are pretty close together and not what I would consider "recreational" but a perfect place to park and venture out from. It's a beautiful area.  The casino is right there,  if that's of interest.
A tale of "two bathrooms"... walking in, this bathroom is pristine,  even the edges and corners.  However,  1 of the 2 shower stalls in the ladies has visible mold in the grout.  More than what would have grown since the previous day's cleaning.

I love this park, every time we visit wadena I make a point to visit here, the deer and bison are wonderful to watch, as is just being there..  .    I even wrote a poem about the beauty of it. I’ve loved this park for 30+ years since I’ve met my now husband of whom was raised in wadena minnesota.

Sunnybrook park
The dew on the grass, reflecting the early morning sun as it stretches its rays, trying to wake up after a long dark cool night..

The birds, turkeys, peacocks, are still nestled in the parks wild flowers, as their blanket, it’s too early to rise..

Even the white tailed deer are curled up in their pen,  with their nose tucked in..  what a gift to see them up close.

I grab a seat on the bench, warm coffee in hand, wrap my soft sweater around my neck, take in GODS creation, time has no place here in thus blissful moment..

A bridge that has stood its time, gives campers a way to cross from the camping side a way to cross over to view Sunnybrook animals,  perhaps a retired couple, enjoying an early morning walk.

Suddenly I’m overcome with sadness, because I know no one seems to need me in the city anymore like they did once before, oh how I’d love to make this our home, it’s become my second home, the place where my love of my life grew up, Sunnybrook park has always held a special place in my heart..

Oh how I wish I had grew up here, for I would have been gifted with a FAMILY I never had, SUNNYBROOK PARK, GOD must have spent alot of time creating HOLY GROUND such as YOU.

Definitely the best private campground we've ever been in (And we are a well
-traveled Couple). The sites are large and beautifully spaced out, landscaping is thoughtful and nicely maintained, the bathhouse is clean and a thoughtful large bench is placed away from spritzing water, modern washer and dryers, sparkling clean pool. The staff was the best. When people say "Minnesota Nice",  their staff and owner epitomize that expression. We hated to leave.

A beautiful meticulously maintained smallish park (42 sites) surrounded by trees.   The sites (full hook up, back in) are larger than average on gravel pads with lush grass between.  They have a pool, laundry, restroom/showers, a pinball machine and a couple of other video games.  If coming from Akeley the sign is not visible so slow down and trust your GPS to find the driveway.

waveland-ms-buccaneer-state-park.editorialSummary: Camping, fishing, disk golf, nature trails & more on 400-acre park on the Gulf.

reviewSummary.text: Buccaneer State Park is beautiful and located right across the street from the Gulf... It's an amazing place to camp and enjoy the beach and the close proximity to Bay St. Louis.

branson-mo-table-rock-state-park.editorialSummary: Popular lakeside recreation area offers boat rentals, camping, biking & hiking trails & a store.

reviewSummary.text: Simply beautiful! Table Rock lake is an incredible sight, with more shoreline than the ENTIRE state of California! My family and I found an abundance of nature trails and saw a wide variety of interesting plant and animal life. We ate wild persimmons on the rocky lake shore and my 2 year old loved stacking up rocks and finding interesting things in the park. We will definitely visit again when able.

Looking for a one night stay while traveling. Offices and store is closed on Sunday and Monday. Off season so pool and mini golf also closed.
Sites are very small and mostly treeless. Pretty much all pull thru sites.
Bathrooms were in terrible shape. 3 unisex units. Two of them that had toilets that were loose from the floor. All 3 had loose seats. Floors were wet and dirty. Sinks were also messy. One had a window that was taped up with foil insulation and looked like a patched hole. Paper towering stuffed into the ceiling vent.
Most of this would have been more tolerable if priced lower for off season. $60 for one night with all these conditions, way over priced.
Would not recommend this place.

I was apprehensive, having seen the other reviews about septic smell, mosquitoes, and wifi. NONE of these things were an issue.

Most reviews of the camp factor the restaurant nextdoor, and while that place is great, my review only applies to the campground.

Our site, #7, was level. Book the row next to the Katy Trail if you want evening shade.

The new trees in the rest of the park are now roughly 20' tall, and growing. Not good for much shade yet, but they'll get there.

The wifi had a strong signal. Couldn't say about the bandwidth, since we didn't use it.

We liked it. Stay was 5/9/25. We'd stay again.

every site is full hook up.
every site is PAVED with PAVED PATIO and picnic table and fire pit!!
The whole campground has nice paved roads.  Some GREAT bike trails, some even lead into town.  I rode my bike to town and grabbed some fresh fruit from Dollar General and it only took about 10 minutes to get there.  A very cool cemetary with carved trees.  Will definitely be going back!! we had a group of 8 campers. We could not all be right next to each other but  within walking distance.  They do offer buddy sites, but the campers DO NOT FACE EACH OTHER..see picture.

lesterville-mo-johnson-s-shut-ins-state-.editorialSummary: Roughly 13 sq. miles of rugged hiking, camping & swimming in a rocky, cascading river.

reviewSummary.text: Located about two hours from St. Louis, this park is absolutely stunning—especially during the fall season in the 3rd or 4th week of October. It offers a scenic walking trail, a nice camping area, and plenty of parking space. You can even step onto the shallow streams that flow gently over the rocks. Elephant Rocks State Park is just a 15-minute drive away, making it easy to visit both in one trip. A must-visit spot to relax, enjoy nature, and soak in the peaceful countryside vibe. Highly recommend!

Perfect stop for my first time doing the entire Katy Trail. I ended the day after a grueling 77 miles and was thrilled to have a tidy and quiet campsite, clean bathroom/showers, and was warmly welcomed by the owner. All at a very reasonable price. Most notably, I felt very safe as a solo traveler at this site. It's obvious they care about their campsite and the experience of their guests. 10/10 recommend.

We stopped here for two nights on our way to Niagara Falls. The lady ar the desk was very friendly and welcoming. The sites were super clean and level and easy to maneuver into with a 40 foot rig. There aren't a lot of amenities at the park, but there's a very nice rail to trail behind it with  access to playgrounds and hiking/biking. The campground is also very close to the main streets in Old St Charles, which is amazing for shopping and dining.

We spent four nights here at 370 Lakeside Park in St Charles MO and loved it. Sites are nicely separated; 45 are paved, 30 are gravel but all appear to be fairly level. You have plenty of room to set up a fence for the pups, or even a picnic tent so you have more shade than just your awning. Clean, quiet campground with a big lake and lots of indoor and outdoor activities for all members of the family, plus two dog parks. Historic St Charles is less than 15 minutes away! Make sure you stop by Grandma's Cookies... Best.Ever.

What a great park! We had a blast here! There are trails to walk on, a huge damn to check out, tons of open area, and a forest to explore! I definitely recommend this place for your next event or to just go walk around!

Stayed for two nights in our Class C.  We were greeted very nicely on arrival and escorted to our site. Check in was quick and easy.  The sites are a bit close but everyone was friendly and the road noise was minimal. We really appreciated the pet friendly but controlled environment. We could take our dogs out without worrying about other dogs being off leash. The field next door is huge and our girls had plenty of room to explore.
The park is very clean and well maintained.
The dog wash looks great but we ran out of time to use it.
Close to Springfield so we’ll be back for our future trips.

Lovely little campground.  I had a full shade spot with a fire ring and table. Only reason I gave 4 stars instead of five are the entrance is pretty steep and the roads are narrow.  If you have a big RV it's a little tight.

Beautiful quiet during weekdays and on the weekend it turns into one huge family staying in their space greeting one another.  Communication is impressive between sites, and woodburning is allowed.
4 huge Turkey Buzzards soaring above my camp each day felt amazing.  The hawks over the lake are beautiful to view, and geckos perched was fascinating to witness.  Trails across the street for biking and walking are very steep.  Great workout! To walk too. Although I didn't fish, the boats were on the water. Beautiful in all the ways. Was able to get fresh chives off the grass to add to my guacamole! The grass had the morning dew and the perfect web of a spiders trap.
I cleaned my own site, and the bathrooms are good.
Met very friendly people and for life.

When you search this park location shows up on the opposite side of the water, but for the are we enjoyed, you want to be right off of S County Line Road. This park has a mix of newer play equipment mixed with retro favorites, such as two merry go rounds. You will also find building with tables for dining or plenty of shade to enjoy a more traditional picnic. Bathrooms are also located on the grounds, but note they may be out of soap, but do have running water. Please be mindful with littles that you are close to a body of water and a road runs between the park and the water…..while driving there and during play, you will more than likely see members of the local Amish community, so be cautious while driving to the the park and in Windsor in general. Have fun!

I chose this RV Park because it was right off the Highway and I didn't have to go into the city to get to it. It is clean, quiet, level, and both Trisha & Bob were extremely friendly and helpful.

I arrived late and had to self check-in. I originally planned to stay 2 nights, due to an RV problem i had to extend 5 more days. I got to stay in the same spot. They offered help to get repaired. And suggested some excellent restaurants.  When I mentioned places I wanted to see they gave me easy directions to get to them from the RV Park.

I would definitely return and recommend this. Oh, and when I first arrived I worried about the neighborhood as I drove under a train bridge. But it isn't sketch. Trust this is a nice RV Park and I feel secure here. Plus my cat has loved it from day one, which is unusual, even the highway noise didn't bother him.

Very nice park.  Late in the season so the fun stuff( paddleboats , restaurants etc) weren't open.  Shower was warm but no locks on doors. Anyone can walk into the restroom and shower while you're in there.  Bathrooms were well stocked with toilet paper but only have air dryer, no paper towels for hands.  We had a small fire pit and picnic table at our site.  Nice walking trails and several geocaches in the park.  25$ plus park pass for 1 night at the rv park for electric only.  You can pay extra for water or higher Amp service.  Quiet except for the occasional helicopter.  We had hoped to visited the Aerospace museum next door but it was closed during our stay.  We will come back when we have more time to enjoy all the amenities.

Nice little campground. Our site was gravel and we were thankful when the storm blew through in the night that the water was able to soak through rather than stand. Laundry facilities and bathrooms were clean. We were just passing through for one night but would definitely stay here again. Recommend advanced reservations if possible. The owners were very warm and welcoming which we appreciated. We travel all over the country and this RV park is nicer than many we have stayed at in the past!

photos.attribution: Oregon Trail RV Park and Cabin
Oregon Trail RV Park and Cabin
Oregon Trail RV Park and Cabin
Oregon Trail RV Park and Cabin

reviewSummary.text: Due to the city’s policy allowing for monthly stays … this area has taken a turn for the worse. There are only 2-3 sites with a 14 day limit, the rest now houses full time renters. Complete with their own dog runs fences and above ground pool. Even if there had been an open spot … for my families safety I would NOT have camped there … nor could I recommend this as a family camp site. I would direct you to the Riverside Park across town.

Doing a cross-country trip and finding stops along the way. This was truly one of the best we've found.  Check-in was quick and informative. The concrete parking pad for the rv was great!  Level, big and centered perfectly. Beautiful grounds and pet area. Restrooms and showers were immaculate (do need to add benches in showers for people to put their change of clothes on).  And the pond and surrounding area is beautiful and peaceful.  Thank you for a great night's stay!

omaha-ne-east-c-campground.editorialSummary: Boating & fishing are permitted seasonally on this scenic lake surrounded by 1,000 leafy acres.

reviewSummary.text: Lake is beautiful. Great bike path all around the lake. Sites are park like and well maintained. Only complaint is the guy who tied his dog up near the road so it could bark at everyone who went by staring around 5:30 am. I would have told the camp host but IT was the guy filling in for the camp host 🤷🏼‍♂️😒

This is a fair priced RV park with large parking spots great for big rigs. Full hookups were nice as well. Really cool to hear the Hyenas at night from the zoo.

It’s very dry and dusty. The trains are noisy. The bathrooms are in poor shape and very dirty. No toilet paper.
If they kept the bathrooms in nice shape, and kept the dust down this would be 5 star.

By far one of the nicest places to stay. For sure one of the most beautiful. Great prices. Clean. Every one is polite.  Location is great. Shopping and downtown are close but not close enough to be bothersome. Well worth a stay.

Able to pay after hours with their envelope system—cash or written card info.  Can’t speak to the bathrooms as I didn’t use them, did see coin operated laundry as I drove by though.  Only $8/night per person for a tent spot.  I think the sign said ~$30ish for an RV spot/night.  Couldn’t find a dedicated tent area but there were plenty of normal spots open.  Perfect for a quick place to pull in for a night on your way through.

boulder-city-nv-lake-mead-rv-village-at-.editorialSummary: Scenic lake & mountain views are offered from this RV park with picnic tables & showers.

reviewSummary.text: Get a lake front site - this is seriously one of the top RV sites we have ever stayed in after more than two years on the road. Beautiful uninterrupted view of Lake Mead and the mountains from every site. RV sites are all a double-wide pad and well spaced out. There are facilities on both sides so you can back in or pull forward depending on your rig. Miles of paved bike paths to explore the surrounding park and short drive to Hoover Dam. There is also a walking / biking trail around the mountain to get to Hoover Dam (used to be an old train line). Absolutely will come back here!!
Amazing place surrounded by mountains. Full hookups, clean, easy access to major highways. So much to do in the area. It’s our second visit in the past four years.

We had another great weekend at Ashuelot River Campground in Swanzey, NH. They have about 75 sites located in wooded areas, open grassy areas, and some that are along the tree line; W/E 30 and 30/50 amp, W/E/S 30 and 30/50 amp, and 3 small cabins. There is a diverse range of site types and locations.

We were in site 59, a pull-through with water and 30/50 amp service. We were in a fully wooded area on the left side of the campground, which we prefer. That section has about 12 sites, some bigger, some smaller.  Our site was spacious, level, and included a picnic table, fire ring, and nicely placed hookups for water and electricity. We had easy access to trails that ran along the river behind some of the wooded sites, with a few paths leading down to the water.

We took our tubes into the river from one side of the campground to the other, enjoying a nice, slow drift back to our site. There is a drought in that area of NH, but a few days of light rain in the previous week helped get the river flowing a bit. We have not taken advantage of their canoe, kayak, and bike rentals, but plan to on one of our future visits. They have a game room, playground, horseshoe pits, and a cornhole set up in the middle of the campground.

Everyone we encountered was friendly and respectful. There are quiet hours from 10 pm to 8 am that are enforced. We were grateful to not have to hear loud partying going on into the night. There was car noise from nearby Rt 10 on the other side of the river, but it was easy to tune it out as it is not a major highway.  We thoroughly enjoyed our time again and will definitely be back.

Attached are a few pictures from our 2 trips, May 2024 and Sept 2025
Nice tiny local little beach. Need a beach badge during the summer but it's nice cool water to chill with the family

cape-may-nj-beachcomber-camping-resort.editorialSummary: Summer opening camp site & RV park with access to swimming pools as well as fishing lakes.

reviewSummary.text: Not quite sure how to rate a camp ground for rooms we stayed in our travel trailer (basically our home away from home). Staff was very friendly. There were a lot of events  going on when we went down, so it was quite enjoyable. The camp ground was clean and very well maintained. Could not have asked for more. We will definitely be going back..
We had a truly wonderful stay here. My son came to visit from Brooklyn and the convenient Metro North stop makes it easy to come up from the city. The sunsets and Fall views were spectacular.

Red Rock Ponds RV Park is a fantastic place to stay! It’s about an hour from Niagara Falls and just 20 minutes from Lake Ontario at Hamlin State Park, making it a great location for exploring. The park has a lot of seasonal sites but also offers both back-in and pull-through spots for travelers.

The gated access adds a sense of security, and the amenities are excellent—two laundry areas, clean bathrooms, and a small store for convenience. Families will especially love the recreation options: a large playground, another play area with climbing and swings, plus fields for soccer and basketball. The big pond and beach area are perfect for relaxing, and the catch-and-release fishing is a wonderful touch.

Overall, it’s a peaceful, well-kept park with plenty to do, whether you’re there for a night or a longer stay. Highly recommend!

fayetteville-ny-green-lakes-state-park.editorialSummary: 2 glacial lakes cast a green glow at this serene park with wooded trails & an 18-hole golf course.

reviewSummary.text: This is the most beautiful, peaceful camp ground we had stayed in a while. The lake it’s absolutely gorgeous and magical. It’s green water takes your breath away. They have a little beach area that is super fun and spacious. They have a great high jump area that is totally safe and just for jumping or diving so you get to really let go and have fun. The kayak ride it’s stunning and truly unique. Definitely a must try and it’s not expensive at all, it’s $40 per 2 hours not bad at all. The walk around the lake it’s a must too. It’s not too long and full of fun and beautiful breath taking spots to rest. We definitely recommend visiting green lakes state park. We don’t have kids but it’s kids friendly and there were lots of kids they were having so much fun. The only thing we didn’t love was that on the morning of us leaving the park staff came at 9:30 am to do the landscape and to cut the grass and the machines were very loud and took away our peace. I think they could have done that after 11 am which is check out time but other then that it’s definitely a magical place to visit with your partner or family ☀️❤️

What a beautiful and quiet RV Park. This place was recommended by friends as somewhere to stay on our road trip going west. Tall trees with dappled shade, green grass, and level sites. There’s a nice laundry room  ($1.50 wash, $1.75 dry, and change making machine) with a small lending library in the same building as the restrooms and showers. The showers are older and not spectacular, but get the job done.
I was in contact with a very nice and helpful woman that took my reservation months ahead, helped me on the phone when I needed a date change, and then checked us in upon arrival. We’re about to head off on our bikes on the very nearby trail (separated completely from traffic) for some exercise and see the surrounding area after a long day on the road.

We love it here! This campground is truly unique — surrounded by beautiful trees and plenty of space between RVs, which makes it feel peaceful and private. It’s also wonderfully pet-friendly 🐶❤️ Our dog loved it as much as we did! A perfect spot to relax and enjoy Lake George. We’ll definitely be back for sure!

lake-george-ny-lake-george-rv-park.editorialSummary: Tree-studded campground with a water park, fishing pond, movie theater & paddle boats.

reviewSummary.text: We have gone back to this park 3 times.  "Rooms" refers to "camp sites" which are excellent for all reasons a camper wants.  You can tell that the money spent on your stay is well managed and put into the camp.  It's definitely a pamper you campground.  We enjoy the fall and enjoyed the Lake George town and the shopping outlets all within 10 minutes, much to do in the area.  I have no negatives to speak of!

lake-george-ny-whippoorwill-motel-and-ca.editorialSummary: Unfussy rustic motel offering simple quarters, some with kitchens, plus an outdoor pool.

reviewSummary.text: Another good RV campground that could be a 5/5 with a little more effort.   In reality there are only two things I would rate lower.  The bathrooms are descent and fairly clean but a daily cleaning is not done.  The showers are fine but as in many campsites not perfect.   While the laundry has free washers only one of the two is operating and there is no place to sort or fold clothes.   Dryers are 3.75 but are large.   So that is the Ricky tacky stuff.  The grounds are clean and good room at each site.   Most are grass and not gravel but are level. There are trees throughout so good shade in the summer.   The entry has a nice seating area and places for kids to romp as well as a pool and small arcade.   The price is consistent with the area and Connor was helpful when onsite and responded quickly by text when he wasn’t.   The old rail now bike path behind the property is great for a walk, run, or bike.  Being right in the main road wasn’t a problem as during the evening it is quiet but early you may hear trucks heading to work.

My husband and I just spent a weekend here and it was the best camping experience we have had this year. Everyone from staff to other campers were so friendly and welcoming. Kari- the manager of the resort is amazing and makes sure things are right and jumps at the opportunity to help with questions. The owners are down to earth friendly people. The bathrooms are amazing, not what you expect for a campground. Highly recommend this campground. Thank you Red’s for a perfect weekend! We’ll be back as we know there’s so much more to explore that we didn’t get to this trip.

photos.attribution: Twilight on the Erie RV Resort
Twilight on the Erie RV Resort
Twilight on the Erie RV Resort

reviewSummary.text: This is my second time going to Whispering Winds campground. I've been to eight different places if you want the quaint little Campground experience. This is the place for you. They make you feel very friendly and welcome and all their activities they go out of your way to help you with anything you need the owners are very friendly. I found out they bought this place at auction a few years back  . yes, there are other bigger Camp Grounds with more to offer but for the price which is very cheap it is that old time feeling of camping like it used to be. I am an older adult and just bought an RV and I will definitely come back here again. The sites are very well-maintained and every site has water, electric and sewer. They also have a very nice pool and rec room.

schaghticoke-ny-adventure-bound-camping-.editorialSummary: Down-to-earth cabins on a relaxed resort offering a heated pool, an inflatable play park & fishing.

reviewSummary.text: We haven't been to this campground in 25+ years and it was so much fun like it was back then. We rented 2 cabins, one with a dog, and we had the best time ever. The store has everything you need. The cabins was spotless and had much more than I expected. Some pots and pans, dish soap, toilet paper and paper towels. Halloween weekend was so much fun and everyone camping and the staff were all very friendly. There's a town nearby too which is helpful. We will definitely be coming back

photos.attribution: Adventure Bound Camping Resorts - Deer Run
Adventure Bound Camping Resorts - Deer Run
Adventure Bound Camping Resorts - Deer Run
Adventure Bound Camping Resorts - Deer Run

asheville-nc-wilson-s-riverfront-rv-park.editorialSummary: Riverfront RV resort with concrete pitches, tent sites, a supply store & a bath house.

reviewSummary.text: We chose this little park for our 4 night stay in Asheville.  This place was hit hard by the storm. They had just reopened when we arrived in September 2025.  The guy on site was still setting up the sites when we got here. He ran right out and got us our picnic table and a new fire ring with a built in grill top on it, which was a nice surprise in case we wanted to use it.  This site has all new electrical on every spot. Full hook up sewer , water and electric.  I read reviews about water pressure but we have no issues, and my wife definitely needs high pressure to wash that super thick hair. (Happy wife, happy life). there is a public bike/ walking trail that runs through the property. Not a deal breaker and we didn't have any issues. We are right off the interstate, I feel like the background sounds are actually helpful to add a little privacy as not to disturb the neighbors.  We can still hear the frogs on the river and its beautiful.   We chose this spot because of the location being central to town as our goal was to explore the region.

We camped out by the river and it was gorgeous, but there was no sand box, or pond, and the play ground was just a swing set and the bathrooms we’re disgusting, especially the ones by the office. Not a good fishing spot, mostly tiny minnows, but a lot of craw dads to catch.

First time camping here and the staff at the check-in desk were super friendly at both check-in and when I went to ask if I needed to check-out in person (you do not need to check-out in person). The bathrooms were also very surprisingly clean (automatic flush) and have showers which were also clean. Other campers were all super nice, whenever I passed someone whether it was a child or adult, they would say hello. Beautiful trails overlooking the lake as well.

geneva-oh-geneva-state-park.editorialSummary: Hiking, fishing, picnics, swimming & boating on a shoreline expanse with camping, cabins & a lodge.

reviewSummary.text: This is such a great state park. Clearwater Beach is fantastic if you are hunting for sea glass or pretty rocks. It wasn't overly crowded and I was there around 5:30p early October. The blue sky and water complimented the changing leaves beautifully and looked like a never ending painting. Spectacular!

lakeview-oh-indian-lake-state-park.editorialSummary: Picnicking, playgrounds & trails on 800 acres, plus lake access for boating, fishing & swimming.

reviewSummary.text:
This place is perfect for families. We picked a spot for camping with electric hook-up so at night we had the l.e.d. lights on. This place has a pool for the kids and a small theater when they have outdoor movies and live shows.
You could rent small kayaks and canoes to spend a quiet time on the lake. The store has items you could buy without leaving the park, everything was amazing.
We are planning the next weekend to come back here and spend time with family again.

mineral-city-oh-atwood-lake-park-campgro.editorialSummary: This public park offers more than 500 campsites, a nature center, a snack bar, swimming & boating.

reviewSummary.text: We asked for one of the water front sites in area H which we understand is new. Nice back in site, concrete with picnic table and fire ring. Nice separation between sites, most of the trees near us were young so minimal shade. Bath house was new and very clean. Laundry was available but only two washers and two dryers. There is a Park store which has a nice variety of stuff - snacks, cleaning supplies, RV stuff and a cafe. Lots of areas to ride our ebikes and walk our best friends. Really nice Park staff.  Very nice dog park near the Welcome Center.

Review is based on the Park Lights at Caesar Ford Park. This is an awesome local free drive through light display, there is a donation box although not advertised.

Really enjoyed how easy it is to access this drive through and the length of the drive through. For a free/donation light display this is awesome a lot to see and some cool features! Some features are not as readable as other places that might be charging 15 plus a Carload but the displays are still very impressive!

braggs-ok-greenleaf-state-park.editorialSummary: Lake boating, fishing & swimming, plus hiking trails, campsites, cabins & other guest amenities.

reviewSummary.text: We’re staying at the RV campsite gobbler Ridge 25. The lawn has been cut and edged everything is clean. The bathrooms are clean. The showers are clean. I can’t emphasize how clean the bathrooms and the showers are!!   They are beyond clean. We’ve enjoyed our stay we’re in campsite 25. Everything is so quiet. They have  nice picnic tables that are sturdy and fairly new. They’re made out of composite wood. Camper cement slabs very level.  And they are extra wide. We have plenty of room behind our camper to put a giant rug the picnic table, chairs, and a lot more. We have extra room on either side of our camper to walk and sit around. I highly recommend the state park.  The paved walking trails are clean- clear of overgrowth and debris. They have new benches along the way as well. Dogs are allowed. They have a Dump station as well.  Last evening wild deer and turkeys were walking through the empty campsite, but stayed a little bit away from us. It was nice to sit at our camp and watch them.
We enjoyed our camping trip. However we did have several quite noisy other campers who liked to blast their music, even after quiet time.

hulbert-ok-sequoyah-state-park.editorialSummary: Boating, golfing, horeseback riding & more at an expansive lake & forested area.

reviewSummary.text: Loved it.  Didn't know this little gem was so close to us. Went for a day trip to check out.  We'll be going back for camping. Did notice some of the site's bathrooms were horribly old to new ones with air and really clean. You might check those out before your pick a spot for primitive camping.
Great neat spot by the dam. Looks like a good place for fishing. Quite a lot of people were there on the weekend.

sand-springs-ok-keystone-state-park.editorialSummary: Lake-centered nature area with fishing, camping, furnished cabins & a seasonal restaurant.

reviewSummary.text: Really liked the walking trails, the covered sheds for the boats moored there, the wide loading ramps, nice office and gift shop. Peaceful and clean. Highly recommend!

Bring a mower and roach killer. They are over priced and have a page long of stuff they can evict you for or tell you to leave. Even if you don’t mind the price, don’t worry. They will raise it. The management in the office doesn’t treat everyone equal either. Bring a mower and roach killer. I have never had a big issue until I came here. Now I have to spray every month or I will have roaches in my house.

From the moment I pulled in, I was impressed. Honcho RV Park blends urban convenience with a peaceful, welcoming atmosphere. The staff went above and beyond to make me feel at home—late check‑in options, helpful guidance on site setup, and genuine hospitality throughout.
The facilities are a standout. Lavish showers, spotless restrooms, and a well‑equipped laundry room make daily life easy, even on the road. The paths and landscaping are well maintained, and even the lighting gives the park a cozy, safe feel at night.
Its location is ideal—close to downtown and major roads—so getting to Tulsa’s attractions was quick and easy. Yet despite the central spot, the park remained remarkably quiet and relaxing.
If you’re looking for an RV park with charm, excellent amenities, attentive staff, and a sense of community, Honcho RV Park is a gem in Tulsa.

I went there looking for a  rv spot, but they didn't have any available. I spent about 30 minutes going through the building, some really cool people, and seems to have a really cool community!!!
I'd love to have been part of it!!!

vian-ok-tenkiller-state-park.editorialSummary: 13,000-acre park along 130 miles of shoreline, offering land & water recreation & a nature center.

reviewSummary.text: Ok. My hubby had some time off work and wanted to swim "in natural water". I could have easily went to a pool. Oh, how it would've been better!! That water was horrible. 10-killer lake is very dirty. The first picture you see is where you are supposed to swim. It's very rocky and nasty. There was a lot is minnows and catfish swimming around. You basically swim in a fish hole. And the boats were passing by quite often, so the water had this oily film. And that's not good. Petrol on the skin can lead to cancer. The weather was very nice and the water was warm....I put my feet in. But that's all, nothing more...just my feet. And they were dirty after. My husband's float toy was super dirty. Oh and the toilets!!! They are Port-a-Potties. There's tissue, but they rock badly. Full..FULL of poo. They weren't clean or maintained well. But they didn't stink. Surprised!? Yeah. Anyway, I AIN'T EVER going back to that crap. They had a place for children, a boat ramp, boat rentals, a regular swimming pool, and places to hook up campers and trailers. For that, I guess it's ok. A fall trip of camping and fishing. (That's what the 2 stars is for. ) But not swimming. I do NOT recommend swimming. The final perk is the drive to and from. Very peaceful. ^__^

Bonnie Hays staff is extremely rude, and if their staff is correct, they are not deserving of your support.  I tried to donate 20lbs of brand new kitty litter and three clean, like new, cozy little throws. They said they're not interested,  that I can go on line and donate money.  THAT'S NOT GOING TO HAPPEN.

Nice & quiet park close to Crater Lake and just a short walk to Diamond Lake which we could see from our site. Lots of waterfalls nearby! Clean restrooms and laundry facilities. Hosts were awesome! We were in site K-1 with a nice view out the back toward the lake. Lots of options for hiking & biking. A++++

The grounds are awesome. Very kid friendly play area and lots of things to do.

Ultimately I left disappointed by the overall customer service that was provided. No employees were solution focused and often responded with a simple yes or no. It took additional questioning to get a resolution on any issue big or small. For example, we needed to make change for the laundry machines, when we asked the store clerk for quarters, he simply said he’s out… we further prompted “is there a place to go for quarters?” At which point we were redirected to the game room.

A similar scenario occurred before our trip ever started. We were hoping to extend our trip, when I called to inquire we were told we can’t extend. We booked an additional night at the sate park across the street. Only to find out what they really meant was our specific site was not available. I tried to further my cause by writing an email to explain that a different site is acceptable, my email and concerns went unaddressed.

Employees also seem eager to leave and close things down. This one employee became very abrasive when clearing the kids’ playground. She began to yell across the playground instead of walking over to speak to any of the kids respectfully.

I have more examples, that said, the overall customer service and the fact that I had to unnecessarily change locations will factor in a low likelihood of me returning and will impact the way I tell people of my stay.

hammond-or-fort-stevens-state-park.editorialSummary: 3,763-acre park with beaches, hiking & biking trails, a historic fortress & a 1906 shipwreck.

reviewSummary.text:
What a great campground! We don't spend much time in campgrounds but we were thrilled with our experience here. Lots of walking and biking trails and the beach is just a thirty minute hike on great trails.
My favorite part of our stay was the laughter from the groups of children as they played together and rode their bicycles.

The good:
it was extremely easy to find since the GAP runs straight through it. Covered shade area with a table & chairs to sit after cycling. Charging stations near my tent. Free showers close to my tent/bike. Inexpensive for 1 night. Ability to get dinner after about cycling 48 miles. Great stop for people bike packing. Had laundry but I didn't use it.
Suggestion:
A rack to secure a bicycle to vs. the tree a had to find. I was glad my cable lock was long enough.

The not so good:
the staff in the cafe/restaurant were very young, didn't listen well & if I didn't repeat multiple times or pay attention to the wrong reponse from her, my order wouldn't be correct. A bit oblivious to customer service.
Overall I was happy & my dinner came out okay.

As most people note it is a little tight to maneuver a camper in and out of the park, even if the camper is small.  The camp spaces are very close but it still manages to feel cozy and friendly.  Although we never met any hosts a very clear packet of information was left at our site, and we received a phone message with clear instructions.  This campground is pet friendly and we enjoyed our stay immensely.  So relaxing and surrounded by such a beautiful State Park.

Great spot right off RT 81 and our sites 52 and 23 for the return trip offered plenty of room. Friendly staff, great kitchen for your dining or snack meals as well.  Don't forget the ice cream!  Great looking playground for the kids too.  Their Halloween spooky ride was outstanding.  All those who work there went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. Renovations are constantly being done too.  If we head down that way again, we will be sure to stop here.

patton-pa-prince-gallitzin-state-park.editorialSummary: Large park with 1,635-acre lake offers horseback riding, disc golfing, camping cottages & more.

reviewSummary.text: The swimming are is very nice and there were lots of swimmers having a blast. Pretty big boats cruising  around. Volleyball  areas,pavilions,charging station for phones . Was pretty busy.

Referred to this campground from friends who have a seasonal spot there. We stayed  for a weekend  & decided to keep our travel trailer there for the season. Boy are we glad we did! We had a blast!. Met a lot of great people. Everyone is so Friendly! Lots of things to do there, 2 pools, basketball courts, tennis/pickleball, playgrounds and more. Staff there are very friendly. We enjoyed our stay so much we renewed for the 2026 season! If you ever get a chance to camp there, we highly suggest looking into it!

We spent a weekend at Indian Rock campground this past March. Dave was great and helped us get into our spot. This is a great campground with a creek and close proximity to the rail trail. Bath houses were clean and well-maintained. We had a great time.

-Bill

charleston-sc-james-island-county-park-a.editorialSummary: Campground with a store, bathrooms, free Wi-Fi, grills & activity center in a 643-acre natural park.

reviewSummary.text: Camped there the first part of November 2025 and it was great.  The dog park is absolutely awesome and there were locals there with their dogs.  We were in a 32 foot RV trailer and had a delightful time on the trails and all around the park.  Had to buy another water hose because a squirrel bit ours and the store is generously stocked with camping gear.  All camp sites were great including the tents and cabins.  Yes, there will be bugs, you are near the coast and there is plenty of water around because you are on an island.

photos.attribution: Campground at James Island County Park
Campground at James Island County Park
Campground at James Island County Park

murrells-inlet-sc-huntington-beach-state.editorialSummary: State park with a secluded beach, a campground & tours of a sprawling, Moorish-style mansion.

reviewSummary.text: There's an $8 per adult charge to enter and for a family of 4 ( 2 adults, a 1 year old and a 4 year old) it was $16, so not too bad. Very beautiful and well maintained place. The parking foe the beach access was very spacious. There's a large playground area near the beach access as well for the kids. A very nice clean beach here as well. We will probably use this area again in the future when we are in the area.

We had an incredible stay in the deluxe cabin with our kiddo and dog. The cabin was spacious for our needs however I would caution that the second room upstairs is accessible by a ladder which might be tough to manage for kids under 5/6. We had a great view of the mountains from our balcony and overall relaxed so much during our trip. Probably one of my favorite cabins we stayed in yet.

The campground itself is very new, clean, and well-maintained. It is located right on the edge of town so we were able to reach food/grocery within 5 or so minutes and custer state park ~15 minutes. Around the campground, we saw so much staff ensuring it was clean and well-appointed. The pool and hot tub were very clean as well and the playground was very fun for young kids. Nights were quiet and the curfew was very much respected.

We can't wait to make our way back.

We camped at Echo Valley Park for a week in our Airstream.   It was a most excellent stay!  The host Gary was super friendly and very helpful.   The views and trails within the park were incredibly scenic, with great views of Crazy Horse and the surrounding mountains. This is a no frills campground. Not a resort.  But it is clean and most of the campsites were moderately spacious and level.  The bath house was clean, and the showers were good.  The price is very reasonable too.  It was a great stay.  And we will be back next time we are in SD.

custer-sd-fort-welikit-family-campground.editorialSummary: Camp sites, cabins, full hook-up & free WiFi plus extras like horse facilities & a fort playground.

reviewSummary.text: We stayed for a week October 2025. Our truck broke down on the way, we were not sure if we had to cancel. The owner was extremely accommodating and fair.  This campground is perfect. Mature trees and flat spots. Uber clean private shower bathrooms. We rode electric bikes, close to downtown Custer and the Michelson trail goes as long as you can. Close to the popular tourist spots. Bike ride into downtown Custer with eating spots and grocery store. Owners are engaged and work hard to keep it clean. He’s also a Vet- so many thanks for his service to our country. We will be back for sure.

We had a site just off the stairs and an amazing view! The place was packed for Sturgis and everything ran without a hitch.

The best part of the location was the trolley into Deadwood! The stop was steps away and it came every half hour. We didn't have to worry about parking, traffic or drinking! This got us to the main drag faster, safer and easier than walking or driving.

The bathrooms are well-kept and clean. We received a few packages without any issues, which is not a given out there!

What a great place! Showers and facility iare perfect!
I forgot great cell phone service!
Thank you Denise!

hill-city-sd-black-hills-trailside-park-.editorialSummary: Log cabins with kitchenettes, free Wi-Fi & private decks in a rustic resort with camping facilities.

reviewSummary.text: One of our favorite campgrounds.  Always clean and well maintained.  Staff is really nice. Love the large showers in in bath house with private rooms. And I feel like there is always enough hot water.  Friends stayed in a cabin. It was nice too. The only issue they had was running out of hot water after 10 min in the shower. We were in our camper. Great place to visit. And the prices are great. We come up and stay here every summer. 4 years now.

We’ve been staying at the campground for the last 10 or more years during the Sturgis Rally.  It’s quiet and right dab in the middle of everything.
While we miss the breakfast they used to put on they still do a Barbecue of chicken and pork a few nights of the rally and have a great DJ playing.  The food this year was phenomenal!  They also have a great little camp store.
The owners and staff are awesome!
The showers and laundry is super clean!!
They pick up your trash and deliver your wood!
The prices during the rally are cheaper than some of the competitors and offer way more !
There’s lots of trees and It’s  always a tad bit cooler then anywhere else so while everyone else is still hot in the evening, your sitting and relaxing by the campfire!
Great dog park and plenty of space for your  cargo trailer if you brought all your toys.
They’ve added some cool patios  and great  fire pits… check out all the great improvements on their web site.. Can’t say enough good stuff about this place !  1st class 💯!

photos.attribution: Larsson's Crooked Creek RV Resort, Lodge and Cabins
Larsson's Crooked Creek RV Resort, Lodge and Cabins
Larsson's Crooked Creek RV Resort, Lodge and Cabins
Larsson's Crooked Creek RV Resort, Lodge and Cabins

reviewSummary.text: We are local the Black Hills. Rafter J is our favorite place to the camp. The sites in ranch camp are spacious, level, and scenic. We have plenty of room to explore, play, and set up our hammocks. Our kids can ride bikes around the loop without fear of heavy traffic. The pool is clean and warm. The playground is fun for all. The shower house is clean and plenty of hot water. We especially like getting ice cream from the camp store. Generous portions of high quality ice cream. The lack of road noise is a main reason we continue to come back.

lead-sd-whitetail-creek-resort.editorialSummary: Functional rooms & wood cabins in a down-to-earth lodge featuring fire pits, barrel saunas & a bar.

reviewSummary.text: This resort is a treasure! I don't even know where to start. The location is convenient. The staff is friendly. The rooms are super clean! There is a creek running by right behind the rooms on the property and seating to enjoy the creek at any time. This is a wonderful place to stay and I will recommend it to everyone. I will return!

The office was closed when we arrived at 1pm on a Tuesday (lunch). There was a packet easily seen with our site number and we found it quickly. Here for 3 days for a concert. Level sites with full hookups. It's very noisy with the highway and airport nearby but we still got some good rest at night.
Park is clean with many seasonal sites which appear to be upkept well.

spearfish-sd-spearfish-city-campground.editorialSummary: Year-round campground with hookup & non-hookup sites, amenities & trout fishing in Spearfish Creek.

reviewSummary.text: We LOVED this campground! Stayed here to tour the black hills area. Some of the sites are small, some are super spacious. There are miles of bike trails (paved) a super nice fish hatchery with ponds of fish literally jumping out of the water, and a park with pickleball courts within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Frequenting Townsend campgrounds growing up I had never been to Mountaineer Campground. This was our first trip/trial run with our new popup and toddler so we wanted to stay relatively close to home and this was the perfect place to spend a long weekend. The campground was relatively full while we were there, but was quiet and everyone around us was friendly and respectful. The office staff went above and beyond in helping us with our original reservation as well as some small setup issues we had. The bath house and showers were clean throughout the entire weekend. Our son had a great time walking the campground and using the playground. Great location as well! Can't wait for our next trip back!

Super clean campground. 10 out of 10. Staff was great. Bathrooms were super clean. They offer a septic tank emptying service if you have a camp spot with no hookup. Cheap and easy. My kids played on the playground and basketball goal. They had a bounce house one day. The  river that runs beside the campground was gorgeous and fun to play in. We will be back.

bastrop-tx-bastrop-state-park.editorialSummary: Large state park featuring forest space filled with pine trees, hiking trails & a lake.

reviewSummary.text: Did a lost pines loop on weekend. The north part of the trail goes deep into the forest. The South part is more on the open. A few CCC buildings on the route, a few people on the route. Very peaceful.

The campground location is the best view of lake, there is limited bike trails and fishing pier as compared to texana Park on other side of street. I personally prefer texana Park but kids like this Park.

goliad-tx-goliad-state-park.editorialSummary: Riverfront green space for camping, hiking, fishing & swimming, also home to a 1750s mission site.

reviewSummary.text:
Lovely experience 3 nights, grounds are well maintained with staff ready to help.  Visitor Center staff was excellent.  I arrived just in time for a guide led tour of the mission & history.  The ranger/guide was EXCELLENT, very knowledgeable & fun.  The mission church & museum has an amazing history.  Restrooms clean/showers hot. I stayed in the water only Longhorn loop, very shaded, deer wandered through.  A trail runs through this loop.
ATT cell coverage good, video download on occasion slower.

grapevine-tx-the-vineyards-campground-an.editorialSummary: Warm cabins with terraces in a relaxed lakeside resort offering direct beach access.

reviewSummary.text: This is a lovely, wooded rv park. The sites are spacious and level. The staff are so nice too. Bathrooms are sparkling. Very close to restaurants and shops in DT Grapevine.the open off leach area for dogs is incredible.  I gave it 4☆ and not 5 because of the "puppy Point" for dogs to swim is disgusting. It's covered with dog crap. It's horrible and unhealthy for dogs. NoT to mention what it's doing to the water.

kerrville-tx-kerrville-schreiner-park-ca.editorialSummary: Park offering a variety of camping options, including RV hookups, tent sites & cabins.

reviewSummary.text: Even though it's open it's lacking maintenance/cleaning. They painted the restrooms and left debris of paint everywhere. Our campsite pourch was dirty, others are the same. We enjoyed coming here (3-5 times/year) but will likely hold off until it is fully open. Currently no access to the river.

We're here for the quilt show. The building is fabulous! There are also RV hook ups. We stayed overnight for just $35.
Also nice sports complex next door with a paved bike track, looks simular to a skateboard track.
The Veterans Memorial is something to see and to give thanks to our Veterans
.

san-antonio-tx-traveler-s-world.editorialSummary: RV resort featuring sites with full hookups & free Wi-Fi, plus a heated pool, a game room & a gym.

reviewSummary.text: The location is slightly in a bad neighborhood.  But we felt safe there. The riverwalk was nice. The facilities was fantastic and clean.  Was very happy with the location.  Definitely going to return again.

bryce-canyon-ut-ruby-s-inn-rv-park-campg.editorialSummary: Relaxed camping complex offering RV sites, cabin & tipi rentals, an outdoor pool, store & eatery.

reviewSummary.text: We've been full time RVing 3 years and I honestly say Ruby's Inn RV park has the largest lot sites We've been.  Nice lawn, built in fire pit , level gravel/dirt parking. Good hook ups.    Nice clean laundry room  . Nice employees, gifts,camp store.  Some walking and hiking paths . No dog park but was allowed our dog off leash in open pasture located on both sides of the the campground.   Ruby's is located near grocery store and restaurants and fairly close to the Bryce NP.

springdale-ut-zion-canyon-campground-rv-.editorialSummary: Family-run campground & RV park with a swimming pool, playground & BBQ grills, plus a laundry room.

reviewSummary.text:
We recently stayed there in a cabin. I cannot say enough about how CLEAN and well kept our cabin was. I genuinely felt like it must have been constructed just before our arrival. The location and views were also spectacular. We parked or car when we arrived and never had need for it again in the 4 days we were there. It was less than 1/2 mile to the zion park entrance. It was an easy walk but it was nice to have the option of riding the free Springdale shuttle as well. Great restaurants next door and across the street too. Service at the texmex next door was incredible - the did was too.

Finally, the staff at the campground was just phenomenal, particularly Nicole and also kathleen. They were happy, helpful, upbeat and genuinely friendly at check-in and every morning when we came in to get coffee, snacks, ice, etc.

I can't thank you enough for an experience that absolutely exceeded our expectations. Can't wait to come back!

photos.attribution: Zion Canyon Campground and RV Resort
Zion Canyon Campground and RV Resort

moab-ut-sun-outdoors-north-moab.editorialSummary: Relaxed campground offering tent & RV sites, plus cabins, a market & free Wi-Fi.

reviewSummary.text: If you are in a small camper or trailer, this park is great, but if you're in a larger motorhome, it's tight.  The RV spots are narrow.  We literally had to move the RZR parked in front of our motorhome so that the people next to us could get out of their spot.  Thankfully, my husband is very skilled at backing our trailer/motorhome, because we are in total around 55 feet long.  And the only place to park our RZR was in front of our motorhome because the spots were so narrow, and the RZR just fit without being in the road.  The RV park was nice and clean.  The office was nice.  The employees were very helpful.  One more thing, the hot tub was out of commission.  Pool looked nice.  Laundry facilities were very nice. Lots of Speed Queen washers and dryers.  You can use a card or cash.  Also, we felt safe there.  Very nice, but only 4 stars due to tiny lots.

north-salt-lake-ut-sun-outdoors-salt-lak.editorialSummary: Informal riverside resort featuring casual log cabins, an outdoor pool & a kids' playground.

reviewSummary.text: I travel for work. Salt lake is where the company is based, so I never know when I will have to be there between jobs. Sun outdoors is always my go to when I have to be in salt lake for a few months or just for the night. The RV park is clean very user friendly for bigger RVs. The staff is amazing they are always friendly and more than happy to make sure you have a great stay. They look after there guests to the point that I was running late to check in and they called to make sure I was ok and see what they could do to make sure when I got there I was taken care of. When I got there it was like seeing family. The maintenance staff is always happy to fill your propane tank or make sure your spot is clean.

This resort is by far better than most. From the moment you check in you feel welcomed and treated like family. The staff is always warm, friendly and helpful. The entire resort is extremely clean. The amenities are great and there’s always something to do. We love the pool and hot tub as well as the many activities they provide. It also has a great dog park. This is a beautiful area and is convenient to everything!!

I was scared to stay here after all the reviews mentioning homeless people but I didn’t notice any of that during my stay. There is a whole homeless tent “neighborhood” right off the bike path, less than 1/2 mile away, but I didn’t see them coming into the campground and my site was right infront of the gate to the bike path. I also felt the campground was very quiet. The location is hard to beat with the beach/lake right across the path. I thought the bathrooms were clean as well. Maybe I just got lucky because it’s mid-October and the cooler weather is hindering the homeless? I would agree the price is too high for what you get. The sites are on top of each other and the WiFi didn’t work. I didn’t even know there were showers until I read a review about them.

We had an awesome Indigenous Peoples’ Weekend at Sugar Ridge with my wife and our two dogs and wow, what a spot! They’ve got it all: LP tank filling, firewood, a heated pool open late into October, mini golf, and a bike trail with views that make you want to keep riding.

The staff were super friendly and always ready to help, and the showers and bathrooms were squeaky clean. We’re already planning our trip back next year and the grandkids are definitely coming with next time.

My family and I had a wonderful stay! We appreciated all the activities even with the impending bad weather the kids had a wonderful time with the costume contest and all the activities provided. The cabin was adorable and very tidy. It was perfect and having included linens was amazing, especially with a lot of campgrounds charging extra for them now,  so it was great for them to be included with our stay. I enjoyed the beautiful views of the bay and the sunsets were magical. The staff was very patient with all my questions and you can tell they care a lot about making sure you are enjoying your vacation. I will definitely be back!

photos.attribution: Cape Charles / Chesapeake Bay KOA Resort
Cape Charles / Chesapeake Bay KOA Resort
Cape Charles / Chesapeake Bay KOA Resort

cape-charles-va-kiptopeke-state-park.editorialSummary: Coastal park at the Eastern Shore's tip, an important bird monitoring area & top hawk-watching site.

reviewSummary.text: It is a nice state park with numerous offerings such as camping, fishing, and hiking. Our purpose was to hike out to the beach and search for shells. It was a beautiful day and we found a great deal of desirable shells. The trails are relatively level and an easy hike. There are some boardwalks with a good number of steps to descend to the beach (which you have to ascend to return, if you choose the same way in and out). I really like this park and this is my third visit this year.

Nice overnight stop 10 miles off I-40.  Sites are rather close together but level with plenty of room to maneuver to back in.  Sites are deep enough were able to leave our crew cab truck hooked up to our 31' travel trailer. There are bike rentals, two dog friendly stores for camping and outdoor gear, a gas station, and several restaurants all in walking distance and a small grocery store a short drive away. We will definitely be back.

This was a great little creekside RV park with full hookups, a good location, a relaxed environment, a nice host, etc. We didn't have any issues pulling our small RV into the lot. It is understandable why the bath house had to be shut down (locals coming and trashing it), but it would have definitely been great to have the bath house as an option for the morning when we had to pack up and leave. One afternoon, it had rained a lot, which made the creek flow really well. While we didn't go tubing ourselves, a lot of families with children really enjoyed tubing down the creek. We loved how close this RV park was to local trails and other nature. Would recommend! :)

I'm so glad I finally got to camp here. It was so worth it. The sites are full hook up with excellent wifi. It looks like most of the sites are pull thru. There's a nice bathhouse with hot water. And there was a babbling stream that ran next to the campsite where I saw deer drink from more than once. The fog on the mountain in the morning was so pretty. Everyone I met was very nice. But best of all, its a short bike ride from the campground to the entrance of the New River Trail. The trail is wide and flat. And you are surrounded by the beauty of the river and mountains with every mile you ride. I can't wait to go back.

Nice, quiet campground with a variety of options - pull through with and without sewer hookups, back in sites with electric and water. The pull through sites are a bit narrow but plenty long for just about any rig.

Best campground ever! The owners are super friendly, accommodating, inclusive, and go out of their way to make sure everyone is happy and enjoying their stay. The bathrooms were nicer than mine at home. The store had excellent convenience options for food, snacks, firewood, etc. The cafe was DELICIOUS and even had vegan options (oat milk for lattes and vegan pizza). Juno is an incredible chef. The sites were a great size and the view of the stars was incredible. If you are hiking Grayson Highlands, this is the place to stay and is way better than the camp there. We didn’t want to leave and we will be back with more friends and family.

williamsburg-va-chickahominy-riverfront-.editorialSummary: A 140-acre  community park with 2 pools, playgrounds, picnicking & riverfront boat access & rentals.

reviewSummary.text: Great site to camp for first time campers. I went with some friends last year and had a great time, there's a pool, kayak rentals and the restroom look good! They have a variety of types or camping from Glamping to RV sites and smaller sites for tents. It's a nice getaway to be out in nature and enjoy campfire stories with friends!

easton-wa-lake-easton-state-park.editorialSummary: 516-acre lakeside park with hiking & snowmobiling trails, campsites & mountain views.

reviewSummary.text:
Lake Easton State Park is a gem in the Cascades and one of the best places we’ve camped. The lake itself is absolutely beautiful, calm, clear water surrounded by forested hills that make every view feel like a postcard. Whether you’re sitting at camp, walking along the trails, or watching the sunset over the water, it’s peaceful and refreshing.

We came in with a truck and toy hauler, and the park had no issues accommodating us. The campsites are well laid out with plenty of space and privacy, and we were able to set up comfortably without feeling crowded. The park is clean, quiet, and really well maintained. Bathrooms and amenities were all in good condition, which made the stay even better.

There’s so much to do here, kayaking, paddle boarding, fishing, biking, or just relaxing by the lake. The trails are fun to explore, and being able to wake up right next to the water is unbeatable. It’s also in a convenient location, making it easy to get in and out without feeling too far from town.

If you’re looking for a scenic, relaxing, and family-friendly spot to camp, Lake Easton State Park should be at the top of your list.

issaquah-wa-issaquah-village-rv-park.editorialSummary: Humble RV park offers 56 sites with full hook-ups, showers & a playground, plus free cable & WiFi.

reviewSummary.text:
The lady at the front office was very cheerful and friendly. You can't walk your dog on the property but they do provide a waste receptacle and poop bags. They direct you to the hike and bike trail, which is paved and across the street.
Sites are very close together and are dried grass with large dead roots remaining from trees previously removed and are easy to trip over. There is no shade. The restrooms were clean but could use a little upkeep such as painting touch-ups and replacing the cracked wood around the mirror. There are sites you cannot park your vehicle in front of, but they give you designated parking. Someone was in my space today so that didn't do me any good. The road noise is horrible, as you are extremely close to the freeway and it doesn't quiet down until at least 11:00 p.m.
For what it is, it's a bit overpriced but, if you have nowhere else to stay or want something 30 minutes into Seattle on a low traffic day, this is an acceptable place to stay. I felt safe and they have plenty of lighting and security cameras on premises.

Liberty Lake Campground is very clean, well maintained campground. The staff is polite and friendly. Nice amenities— including pool, showers houses, activity room, playground, and sizable dog park. All sites had concrete pads, including for a picnic table area, yet still included a nice well kept grass area on each lot. Grass is thick and green so much so that I laid on it multiple times throughout our stay. All sites were well placed. Good communication from staff. Other campers were all very friendly. Well maintained roads. Campground had street lights. Stunning mountain views. Close to shopping and restaurants. Incredible water pressure and excellent electrical hookups. Feels secluded even though it’s right in the heart of Liberty Lake.

sequim-wa-sequim-bay-state-park.editorialSummary: Oceanfront park with year-round camping, docks, hiking trails, baseball field & basketball court.

reviewSummary.text: A very nice state park. Campsites are taken care of and look great. I will say there is one small detractor - the proximity to Hwy 101.... hearing cars zoom past at 11:30 at night on their way home from the casino is fun. I enjoyed my evening there and will likely return... also, it was cool getting scolded by three different campers about having a fire in my propane fire pit. Instead of hating, bring over some beers and let's enjoy some gas powered camp fire!

spokane-wa-bowl-pitcher-campground.editorialSummary: Picturesque, riverside retreat offering campgrounds, plus hiking & cycling trails.

reviewSummary.text: I went almost 5 miles but I also didnt stay on the main trail.   This place is absolutely breathtaking taking and only a 15 - 20 minute drive from Spokane.   The views are breathtaking as are the trails.  I saw lots of people walking their dogs on leash as well as riding their bikes through the trails.   Plenty of parking there is even a camp ground.  Definitely a beautiful place to come explore.   Discover Pass required.

My husband and I stayed here for about 2 weeks around the 4th of July. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our 2 week reservation was broken up by a weekend and they accommodated our request to be back in the same spot. Check in was easy and navigation to our spot was simple.

The KOA has a lot of amenities. We enjoyed the pool (that was often a little crowded with kids) and playing basketball on the court out front. Our site was large and we had a picnic table that was shaded by the trees.

The KOA was a little more expensive than what it was worth, but overall, we really enjoyed our stay.

wenatchee-wa-lincoln-rock-state-park.editorialSummary: Small park above Rocky Reach Dam with campsites, a protected swimming area, docks & playing fields.

reviewSummary.text: Soooo much fun! My family and I love it here, its our 2nd time coming. Great views, boat launch, swimming are for the kids and a nice playground.  They have bathrooms where you can also take a hot shower. Nice for taking a bike ride as well. The views out on the water are beautiful. Definitely coming back again next summer.

wenatchee-wa-wenatchee-confluence-state-.editorialSummary: 187-acre park offers camping, sports fields, swimming & wetlands at the confluence of 2 rivers.

reviewSummary.text: Our first visit to Confluence state park. We were in a pull thru with full hookups at site 7. First the sites are a good distance from each other and the outside loop feels like you are in your own park, grass from the tent pad out to the park boundry. Very clean sites was our first impression and nice picnic pads as well. The park is where the Wenatchee and Columbia rivers meet making for some beautiful scenery as well as abundant wild life everywhere. This is a year round site and would be great in late  fall as well as early spring. We were treated to 75 degrees in late April. Lots of biking and walking trails as well as a large green grassy day use area. We highly recommend!

This was absolutely the best place to camp while day tripping the area and riding the Greenbrier Rail Trail!  The sites were huge with plenty of space for privacy if that is your thing.   There are a multitude of eateries / coffee shops within a short walk.  Groceries are less than a mile away.   You can ride your bike directly from your campsite to the trail in seconds.  There is a bike shop in and old grocery store a couple of blocks down the street that will transport you and your bikes to most anywhere on the trail which works great.  The trail itself is well maintained with places to eat right on the trail.

I've been going to five river campground  for a couple years now and it's always a great time. I love the atmosphere and the staff and the owners. Everyone makes you feel very comfortable. I'm going back in a couple weeks for a week of bluegrass and I'm looking forward to the sound of the river at night and bluegrass through the day.  Thank you John, Joyce, and Kate for the amazing job that you do. You guys are an awesome group site 200 in shady grove feels like home every time I'm there.

Wonderful time at camp holiday. Very friendly,very helpful. We camped for 7 days and the pictures are of our whole site it was a pull through site and was huge. Very beautiful place the bathroom \ showers were like luxury. The lake was beautiful. Definitely will be going back. The people were very friendly.

We spent a couple of nights Mid September and had a very pleasant stay. We enjoyed the lakeside campsite which was clean and easy to level out. It was the quiet period and very peaceful watching the occasional fishing boats from our site. We took advantage of the nearby bike trail on a warm day. The owners and staff were very friendly and helpful and the store was well stocked. We would definitely recommend for families.

This was our very first time here with our travel trailer. The staff in the check in office were very helpful and friendly. This RV park is very clean and has nearby access to the freeway  They have some pull through 30 amp and 50 amp with electricity. They also have dry sites just for parking. They have some pull through sites with full hook ups. They also have a clean laundry facility with showers and restrooms. We will definitely be back again.

photos.attribution: Wisconsin State Fair RV Park - Open Year-Round!

tucson-az-catalina-state-park.editorialSummary: Park at the foot of the Santa Catalina Mountains with 5,500 acres for hiking, camping & more.
